Description: Body sherd of body of Clazomenian or East Greek black figure painted pottery amphora or hydria. Scales containing white drops.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 11
Curator's comments: Belongs with BM GR 1888,0208.79.b which has the Findspot number '11' scratched on the back. Philadelphia E.147.38, with similar scales, may be from the same pot. BSA xlvii, 143, n. 102-no. 11 (and no. 11a)
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (pl. GB 590, 31)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 113)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.207)
